name: Full Stack Web Development Bootcamp
author: Angela Yu
description: Learn HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB through hands-on, real-world projects.
You’ll master frontend to backend essentials and deploy full-stack applications to live servers.
Includes detailed modules on deployment, hosting, and version control best practices.

name: Modern React with Redux
author: Stephen Grider
description: Master React and Redux by building real-world applications and diving deep into state management.
Learn functional components, hooks, and middleware integration in real use-cases.
This course is ideal for intermediate devs wanting to build scalable frontend systems.

name: Responsive Web Design Masterclass
author: Jonas Schmedtmann
description: Learn modern HTML5, CSS3, Flexbox, and Grid with real responsive design projects.
Understand media queries, layout principles, and accessibility features.
Build pixel-perfect websites that look great on desktops, tablets, and mobiles.

name: Next.js & Tailwind Complete Guide
author: Maximilian Schwarzmüller
description: Build fast, SEO-friendly apps with Next.js and Tailwind CSS from scratch.
Includes routing, server-side rendering, and headless CMS integration.
Ideal for those who want to master performance and design in React ecosystems.

name: Master the Coding Interview – DSA
author: Andrei Neagoie
description: Learn DSA through visual explanations, and ace technical interviews at top tech companies.
Covers arrays, strings, trees, graphs, recursion, and dynamic programming.
Includes mock interview problems from Google, Facebook, and Amazon.

name: Data Structures in C++
author: Abdul Bari
description: Learn all essential DSA concepts with deep explanations in C++ programming.
Includes stack, queue, linked list, tree, graph, hashing and their implementations.
This course helps build logic from scratch for competitive coding and interviews.

name: Python for DSA and Competitive Coding
author: Gaurav Sen
description: Solve problems from scratch using Python with in-depth DSA logic and optimizations.
Includes real-time walkthroughs, time complexity analysis, and visualizations.
Great for both beginners and intermediate coders preparing for contests.

name: 450 DSA Questions Course (Crack SDE Interviews)
author: Love Babbar
description: Cover 450 curated problems across arrays, strings, graphs, DP, and more with dry runs.
Structured to cover beginner to advanced topics with interview-level questions.
Includes guided problem-solving techniques and efficient time-complexity analysis.

name: Machine Learning A-Z™: Hands‑On Python & R
author: Kirill Eremenko & Hadelin de Ponteves
description: Hands‑on projects covering regression, classification, clustering, and NLP techniques.
Includes both Python and R implementations, with end‑to‑end model pipelines.
Ideal for real‑world applications using case studies and business problem‑solving.

name: Data Science with Python
author: Jose Portilla
description: Explore pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, sklearn, and more with real datasets.
From data cleaning to visualization and model building — all covered.
Ideal for learners with Python basics looking to dive into data analysis.

name: Deep Learning Specialization
author: Andrew Ng
description: Learn neural networks, CNNs, and sequence models with hands‑on projects in TensorFlow.
This Coursera‑originated series covers the core of AI systems.
Taught by a world‑renowned AI researcher — a must‑have credential.

name: Data Analysis with Pandas and NumPy
author: Alex The Analyst
description: Perform exploratory data analysis using powerful Python libraries with hands‑on files.
Covers data cleaning, grouping, merging, reshaping, and visualizations.
Ideal for analytics job seekers or researchers handling large datasets.

name: Flutter & Dart – The Complete Guide
author: Maximilian Schwarzmüller
description: Build native‑like iOS and Android apps with Flutter, including animations and Firebase integration.
Cover state management, custom widgets, REST APIs, and deployment to App‑Store/Play‑Store.
Great for developers wanting a single codebase for multiple platforms.

name: Android App Development with Kotlin
author: Philipp Lackner
description: Learn Kotlin and Android Studio to build real‑world native Android apps.
Includes Jetpack Compose, Room DB, Coroutines, and MVVM architecture.
Great for anyone targeting modern Android development from scratch.

name: iOS App Development with Swift
author: Angela Yu
description: Build beautiful native iOS apps with Swift 5 and Xcode from beginner to pro.
Explore UIKit, CoreData, SwiftUI, and integrate APIs in functional apps.
Perfect for iPhone/iPad dev aspirants looking to publish apps on App Store.

name: React Native – The Practical Guide
author: Academind by Maximilian
description: Build cross‑platform mobile apps using React Native and Expo.
Includes navigation, native device features, and state management.
Suited for web developers transitioning into mobile app space.

name: The Complete Ethical Hacking Course
author: Zaid Sabih
description: Learn penetration testing, network hacking, and web‑app security from scratch.
Includes Kali Linux tools, WiFi cracking, and system exploitation hands‑on.
Get real experience in ethical hacking with legal and ethical practices.

name: Learn Ethical Hacking from Scratch
author: ZSecurity
description: Use practical hacking tools, learn WiFi and system security with demos.
Deep dives into footprinting, phishing, sniffing, and social engineering.
Great starting point for those curious about cybersecurity careers.

name: Cyber Security Crash Course for Beginners
author: Nathan House
description: Learn how to protect yourself and your data with easy-to-understand examples.
Includes phishing, malware, ransomware, and social engineering awareness.
Perfect for non-techies and beginners seeking foundational cyber hygiene.

name: Red Team Ethical Hacking Masterclass
author: Heath Adams
description: Hands‑on red‑team training in real environments using Kali Linux and Metasploit.
Focuses on evasion techniques, lateral movement, and privilege escalation.
Meant for advanced users aiming at offensive security careers.
